targets.legendFormat: System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Irq - Servicing interrupts
Softirq - Servicing softirqs
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
Guest - Time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system

targets.expr: node_memory_MemTotal{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_MemFree{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_Buffers{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_Cached{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_Slab{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_PageTables{instance=~"$node"} - node_memory_SwapCached{instance=~"$node"}
targets.legendFormat: Apps - Memory used by user-space applications
PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses
SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified
Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)
Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache
Buffers - Block device (e.g. harddisk) cache
Unused - Free memory unasigned
Swap - Swap space used
Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
{{device}} - Receive
{{device}} - Transmit
{{mountpoint}}
{{device}} - Successfully read bytes
{{device}} - Successfully written bytes
{{device}} - Milliseconds spent doing I/Os
Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes
Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary
Committed_AS - Amount of memory presently allocated on the system
CommitLimit - Amount of  memory currently available to be allocated on the system
Inactive_file - File-backed memory on inactive LRU list
Inactive_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)
Active_file - File-backed memory on active LRU list
Active_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs
Writeback - Memory which is actively being written back to disk
WritebackTmp - Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers
Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk
Mapped - Used memory in mapped pages files which have been mmaped, such as libraries
Shmem - Used shared memory (shared between several processes, thus including RAM disks)
SUnreclaim - Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure
SReclaimable - Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches
VmallocChunk - Largest contigious block of vmalloc area which is free
VmallocTotal - Total size of vmalloc memory area
VmallocUsed - Amount of vmalloc area which is used
Bounce - Memory used for block device bounce buffers
AnonHugePages - Memory in anonymous huge pages
AnonPages - Memory in user pages not backed by files
KernelStack - Kernel memory stack. This is not reclaimable
HugePages_Free - Huge pages in the pool that are not yet allocated
HugePages_Rsvd - Huge pages for which a commitment to allocate from the pool has been made, but no allocation has yet been made
HugePages_Surp - Huge pages in the pool above the value in /proc/sys/vm/nr_hugepages
HugePages - Total size of the pool of huge pages
Hugepagesize - Huge Page size
DirectMap1G - Amount of pages mapped as this size
DirectMap2M - Amount of pages mapped as this size
DirectMap4K - Amount of pages mapped as this size
Unevictable - Amount of unevictable memory that can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons
MLocked - Size of pages locked to memory using the mlock() system call
NFS Unstable - Memory in NFS pages sent to the server, but not yet commited to the storage
Pagesin - Page in operations
Pagesout - Page out operations
Pswpin - Pages swapped in
Pswpout - Pages swapped out
Pgdeactivate - Pages moved from active to inactive
Pgfree - Page free operations
Pgactivate - Pages moved from inactive to active

seriesOverrides.alias: Pgfault - Page major and minor fault operations

targets.legendFormat: Pgfault - Page major and minor fault operations
Pgmajfault - Major page fault operations
Pgminfault - Minnor page fault operations
Kswapd_inodesteal - Pages reclaimed via kswapd inode freeing
Pgindesteal - Pages reclaimed via inode freeing
Pageoutrun - Kswapd calls to page reclaim
Allocstall - Direct reclaim calls
Zone_reclaim_failed - Zone reclaim failures
Pgrotated - Pages rotated to tail of the LRU
Drop_pagecache - Calls to drop page cache pages
Drop_slab - Calls to drop slab cache pages
Slabs_scanned - Slab pages scanned
Unevictable_pgs_cleared - Unevictable pages cleared
Unevictable_pgs_culled - Unevictable pages culled
Unevictable_pgs_mlocked - Unevictable pages mlocked
Unevictable_pgs_munlocked - Unevictable pages munlocked
Unevictable_pgs_rescued- Unevictable pages rescued
Unevictable_pgs_scanned - Unevictable pages scanned
unevictable_pgs_stranded - Unevictable pages stranded
Pgalloc_dma - Dma mem page allocations
Pgalloc_dma32 - Dma32 mem page allocations
Pgalloc_movable - Movable mem page allocations
Pgalloc_normal - Normal mem page allocations
Pgrefill_dma - Dma mem pages inspected in refill_inactive_zone
Pgrefill_dma32 - Dma32 mem pages inspected in refill_inactive_zone
Pgrefill_movable - Movable mem pages inspected in refill_inactive_zone
Pgrefill_normal - Normal mem pages inspected in refill_inactive_zone
Pgsteal_direct_dma - Dma mem pages stealed
Pgsteal_direct_dma32 - Dma32 mem pages scanned
Pgsteal_direct_movable - Movable mem pages scanned
Pgsteal_direct_normal - Normal mem pages scanned
Pgsteal_kswapd_dma - Dma mem pages scanned by kswapd
Pgsteal_kswapd_dma32 - Dma32 mem pages scanned by kswapd
Pgsteal_kswapd_movable - Movable mem pages scanned by kswapd
Pgsteal_kswapd_normal - Normal mem pages scanned by kswapd
Pgscan_direct_dma - Dma mem pages scanned
Pgscan_direct_dma32 - Dma32 mem pages scanned
Pgscan_direct_movable - Movable mem pages scanned
Pgscan_direct_normal - Normal mem pages scanned
Pgscan_direct_throttle -
Pgscan_kswapd_dma - Dma mem pages scanned by kswapd
Pgscan_kswapd_dma32 - Dma32 mem pages scanned by kswapd
Pgscan_kswapd_movable - Movable mem pages scanned by kswapd
Pgscan_kswapd_normal - Normal mem pages scanned by kswapd
Compact_free_scanned - Pages scanned for freeing by compaction daemon
Compact_isolated - Page isolations for memory compaction
Compact_migrate_scanned - Pages scanned for migration by compaction daemon
Compact_fail - Unsuccessful compactions for high order allocations
Compact_stall - Failures to even start compacting
Compact_sucess - Successful compactions for high order allocations
Kswapd_high_wmark_hit_quickly - Times high watermark reached quickly
Kswapd_low_wmark_hit_quickly - Times low watermark reached quickly
Htlb_buddy_alloc_fail - Huge TLB page buddy allocation failures
Htlb_buddy_alloc_success - Huge TLB page buddy allocation successes
Numa_foreign - Foreign NUMA zone allocations
Numa_hit - Successful allocations from preferred NUMA zone
Numa_interleave - Interleaved NUMA allocations in each zone for each NUMA node
Numa_local - Successful allocations from local NUMA zone
Numa_miss - Unsuccessful allocations from preferred NUMA zona
Numa_other - Unsuccessful allocations from local NUMA zone
Numa_pages_migrated - NUMA page migrations
Pgmigrate_fail - Unsuccessful NUMA page migrations
Pgmigrate_success - Successful NUMA page migrations
Numa_hint_faults - NUMA hint faults trapped
Numa_hint_faults_local - Hinting faults to local nodes
Numa_pte_updates - NUMA page table entry updates
Numa_huge_pte_updates - NUMA huge page table entry updates
Thp_split - Transparent huge page splits
Workingset_activate - Page activations to form the working set
Workingset_nodereclaim - NUMA node working set page reclaims
Workingset_refault - Refaults of previously evicted pages
Thp_collapse_alloc - Transparent huge page collapse allocations
Thp_collapse_alloc_failed - Transparent huge page collapse allocation failures
Thp_zero_page_alloc - Transparent huge page zeroed page allocations
Thp_zero_page_alloc_failed - Transparent huge page zeroed page allocation failures
Thp_fault_alloc - Transparent huge page fault allocations
Thp_fault_fallback - Transparent huge page fault fallbacks
Active_anon - Active anonymous memory pages
Active_file - Active file memory memory pages
Inactive_anon - Inactive anonymous memory pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Inactive_file - Inactive file memory pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Reclaimable - Instantaneous reclaimable slab pages
Unreclaimable - Instantaneous unreclaimable slab pages
Free_pages - Free pages
Written - Pages written out in each zone for each NUMA node
Dirty - Pages in dirty state
Bounce - Bounce buffer pages
Unevictable - Unevictable pages
Mlock - Pages under mlock
Shmem - Shared memory pages
Mapped - Mapped pagecache pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Kernel_stack - Pages of kernel stack
Writeback - Writeback pages
Writeback_temp - Temporary writeback pages
File_pages - File pagecache pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Dirty_background_threshold - Background writeback threshold
Dirty_threshold - Dirty throttling threshold
Unstable - Pages unstable state in each zone for each NUMA node
Dirtied - Pages entering dirty state in each zone for each NUMA node
Page_table_pages - Page table pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Alloc_batch - Pages allocated to other zones due to insufficient memory for each zone for each NUMA node
Isolated_anon - Isolated anonymous memory pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Isolated_file - Isolated file memory pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Anon_pages - Anonymous mapped pagecache pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Anon_transparent_hugepages - Anonymous transparent huge pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Free_cma - Free Contiguous Memory Allocator pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Vmscan_write - Pages written by VM scanner from LRU
Immediate_reclaim - Prioritise for reclaim when writeback ends in each zone for each NUMA node
Context switches
Interrupts
Entropy available to random number generators

{{device}} - Transmit drop

TCP_alloc - Allocated sockets
TCP_inuse - Tcp sockets currently in use
TCP_mem - Used memory for tcp
TCP_orphan - Orphan sockets
TCP_tw - Sockets wating close
UDPLITE_inuse - Udplite sockets currently in use
UDP_inuse - Udp sockets currently in use
UDP_mem - Used memory for udp
Sockets_used - Sockets currently in use
TCP_mem_bytes -
UDP_mem_bytes -
FRAG_inuse - Frag sockets currently in use
FRAG_memory - Used memory for frag
RAW_inuse - Raw sockets currently in use
InReceives - Ip inreceives
DefaultTTL - Default TTL
InDelivers - Ip indelivers
OutRequests - Ip outrequests
InOctets - Received octets
OutOctets - Sent octets
InBcastPkts - Received IP broadcast datagrams
OutBcastPkts - Sent IP broadcast datagrams
InBcastOctets - Received IP broadcast octets
OutBcastOctets - Sent IP broadcast octects
InMcastPkts - Received IP multicast datagrams
OutMcastPkts - Sent IP multicast datagrams
InMcastOctets - Received IP multicast octets
OutMcastOctets - Sent IP multicast octets
ForwDatagrams - Ip outforwdatagrams
Forwarding - Ip forwarding
FragCreates - Ip fragmentation creations
FragFails - Ip fragmentation failures
FragOKs - Ip fragmentation oks
InCEPkts - Congestion Experimented datagrams in
InECT0Pkts - Datagrams received with ECT(0)
InECT1Pkt - Datarams received with ECT(1)
InNoECTPkts - Datagrams received with NOECT
ReasmFails - Ip reassembly failures
ReasmOKs - Ip reassembly oks
ReasmReqds - Ip reassembly requireds
ReasmTimeout - Ip reasmtimeout
InDiscards - Ip indiscards
InHdrErrors - Ip inhdrerrors
InUnknownProtos - Ip inunknownprotos
OutDiscards - Ip outdiscards
OutNoRoutes - Ip outnoroutes
InNoRoutes - IP datagrams discarded due to no routes in forwarding path
InCsumErrors - IP datagrams with checksum errors
InTruncatedPkts - IP datagrams discarded due to frame not carrying enough data
InAddrErrors - Ip inaddrerrors
InCsumErrors - Segments received with checksum errors
InErrs - Segments received in error (e.g., bad TCP checksums)
InSegs - Segments received, including those received in error. This count includes segments received on currently established connections
OutRsts - Segments sent containing the RST flag
OutSegs - Segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets
RetransSegs - Segments retransmitted - that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmitted octets
CurrEstab - TCP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE- WAIT
MaxConn - Limit on the total number of TCP connections the entity can support (Dinamic is "-1")
RtoAlgorithm - Algorithm used to determine the timeout value used for retransmitting unacknowledged octets
RtoMax - Maximum value permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds
RtoMin - Minimum value permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds
ActiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state
AttemptFails - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SYN-SENT and SYN-RCVD
EstabResets - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the ESTABLISHED state or the CLOSE-WAIT state
PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state
TCPAbortOnClose - Connections aborted due to early user close
TCPAbortOnData - Connections aborted due to unexpected data
TCPAbortOnLinger - Connections aborted in lingered state after being closed
TCPAbortOnMemory - Connections aborted before attached to a socket
TCPAbortOnTimeout - Connections aborted due timeout
TCPAbortFailed - Connections aborted without send RST due insuffient memory
TCPTimeouts - Other TCP connections timeouts
DelayedACKLocked - Delayed acks further delayed because of locked socket
DelayedACKLost - Times quick ack mode was activated
DelayedACKs - Delayed acks sent
SyncookiesFailed - Invalid SYN cookies received
SyncookiesRecv - SYN cookies received
SyncookiesSent - SYN cookies sent
SynChallenge - Challenge ACKs sent in response to SYN packets
TCPChallengeACK - Challenge ACKs sent (RFC 5961 3.2)
TCPLossFailures - Timeouts in loss state
TCPLossProbeRecovery - TCP loss probe recoveries
TCPLossProbes - Sent TCP loss probes
TCPLossUndo - Congestion windows recovered without slow start after partial ack
TCPLostRetransmit - Retransmits lost
ListenDrops - SYNs to LISTEN sockets ignored
LockDroppedIcmps - ICMP packets dropped because socket was locked
TCPDeferAcceptDrop - Dropped ACK frames received by a socket in SYN_RECV state
TCPBacklogDrop - Packets dropped bacause the socket's receive queue was full
OutOfWindowIcmps - ICMP packets dropped because they were out-of-window
TCPMinTTLDrop - TCP packets dropped under minTTL condition
TCPForwardRetrans - Packets losts retransmitted with Forward RTO-Recovery
TCPSlowStartRetrans - Packets losts retransmitted after a slow start
TCPSynRetrans - SYN-SYN/ACK retransmits to break down retransmissions in SYN, fast/timeout retransmits
TCPSpuriousRTOs - FRTO's successfully detected spurious RTOs
TCPSpuriousRtxHostQueues - Times detected that the fast clone is not yet freed in tcp_transmit_skb()
TCPFullUndo - Retransmits that undid the CWND reduction
TCPRetransFail - Failed tcp_retransmit_skb() calls
TCPPartialUndo - Congestion windows partially recovered using Hoe heuristic
PruneCalled - Pkts pruned from recv queue because of soc buf overrun
RcvPruned - Packets pruned from receive queue
OfoPruned - Packets dropped from out-of-order queue because of socket buffer overrun
OfoPruned - Packets dropped from out-of-order queue because of socket buffer overrun
TCPDirectCopyFromBacklog - Packets directly received from backlog
TCPDirectCopyFromPrequeue - Packets directly received from prequeue
TW - TCP sockets finished time wait in fast timer
TWKilled - TCP sockets finished time wait in slow timer
TWRecycled - Time wait sockets recycled by time stamp
TCPTimeWaitOverflow - Occurences of time wait bucket overflow
PAWSActive - Active connections rejected because of time stamp
PAWSEstab - Pkts rejects in estab connections because of timestamp
PAWSPassive - Passive connections rejected because of time stamp
TCPSackRecovery - Times recovered from packet loss by selective acknowledgements
TCPSackRecoveryFail - Issue while recovering packets lost using selective ACK
TCPSackShiftFallback - SACKs fallbacks
TCPSackShifted - SACKs shifted
TCPSackDiscard -  Discarded due invalid SACK block.
TCPSackFailures - Timeouts after SACK recovery
TCPSackMerged - SACKs merged
TCPSACKReneging - Bad SACK blocks received
TCPSACKReorder - Times detected reordering using SACK
TCPDSACKIgnoredOld - Discarded packets with duplicate SACK while retransmitting
TCPDSACKOfoRecv - DSACKs for out of order packets received
TCPDSACKOfoSent - DSACKs sent for out of order packets
TCPDSACKOldSent - DSACKs sent for old packets
TCPDSACKRecv - DSACKs received
TCPDSACKUndo - Discarded packets with erroneous retransmit
TCPDSACKIgnoredNoUndo - Discarded packets with duplicate SACK
TCPFastOpenActive - Successful outbound TFO connections
TCPFastOpenActiveFail - SYN-ACK packets received that did not acknowledge data sent in the SYN packet and caused a retransmissions without SYN data
TCPFastOpenCookieReqd - Inbound SYN packets requesting TFO with TFO set but no cookie
TCPFastOpenListenOverflow - Times the fastopen listen queue overflowed
TCPFastOpenPassive - Successful inbound TFO connections
TCPFastOpenPassiveFail - Inbound SYN packets with TFO cookie that was invalid
TCPFastRetrans - Packets lost fast-retransmitted
TCPHPAcks - Acknowledgments not containing data received
TCPHPHits - Packets header predicted
TCPHPHitsToUser - Packets header predicted and directly queued to user
TCPToZeroWindowAdv - Times window went from zero to non-zero
TCPWantZeroWindowAdv - Times zero window announced
TCPFromZeroWindowAdv - Times window went from zero to non-zero
TCPFACKReorder - Detected packets with re-ordering using FACK
TCPTSReorder - Times detected packets with re-ordering using timestamp option
TCPRenoFailures  - Timeouts after reno fast retransmit
TCPRenoRecovery - Times recovered from packet loss due to fast retransmit
TCPRenoRecoveryFail - Times reno fast retransmits failed
TCPRenoReorder - Times detected reordering using reno fast retransmit
TCPReqQFullDoCookies - Times SYNCOOKIE was replied to client
TCPReqQFullDrop - Times SYN request was dropped due to disabled syncookies
TCPOFODrop - Packets meant to be queued in OFO but dropped because socket rcvbuf limit reached
TCPOFOMerge - Packets in OFO that were merged with other packets
TCPOFOQueue - Packets queued in OFO queue
TCPMD5NotFound - Times MD5 hash expected but not found
TCPMD5Unexpected - Times MD5 hash unexpected but found
TCPPrequeued - Packets directly queued to recvmsg prequeue
TCPPrequeueDropped - Packets dropped from prequeue
TCPRcvCoalesce - Times tried to coalesce the receive queue
TCPRcvCollapsed - Packets collapsed in receive queue due to low socket buffer
TCPOrigDataSent - Outgoing packets with original data
ArpFilter - Arp packets filtered
IPReversePathFilter - Packets arrive from non directly connected network
TCPPureAcks - Acknowledgments not containing data payload received
TCPAutoCorking - Times stack detected skb was underused and its flush was deferred
BusyPollRxPackets - Low latency application-fetched packets
EmbryonicRsts - Resets received for embryonic SYN_RECV sockets
ListenOverflows - Times the listen queue of a socket overflowed
TCPSchedulerFailed - Times receiver scheduled too late for direct processing
TCPMemoryPressures - TCP ran low on memory
InDatagrams - Datagrams received
OutDatagrams - Datagrams sent
InCsumErrors - Datagrams with checksum errors
InErrors - Datagrams that could not be delivered to an application
RcvbufErrors - Datagrams for which not enough socket buffer memory to receive
SndbufErrors - Datagrams for which not enough socket buffer memory to transmit
NoPorts - Datagrams received on a port with no listener
InDatagrams - Packets received
OutDatagrams - Packets sent
InCsumErrors - Datagrams with checksum errors
InErrors - Datagrams that could not be delivered to an application
RcvbufErrors - Datagrams for which not enough socket buffer memory to receive
SndbufErrors - Datagrams for which not enough socket buffer memory to transmit
NoPorts - Datagrams received on a port with no listener
InErrors - Messages which the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.)
OutErrors - Messages which this entity did not send due to problems discovered within ICMP, such as a lack of buffers
InDestUnreachs - Destination Unreachable messages received
OutDestUnreachs - Destination Unreachable messages sent
InType3 - Destination unreachable
OutType3 - Destination unreachable
InCsumErrors - Messages with ICMP checksum errors
InTimeExcds - Time Exceeded messages received
OutTimeExcds - Time Exceeded messages sent
InParmProbs - Parameter Problem messages received
OutParmProb - Parameter Problem messages sent
InSrcQuenchs - Source Quench messages received
OutSrcQuenchs - Source Quench messages sent
InMsgs -  Messages which the entity received. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors
InRedirects - Redirect messages received
OutMsgs - Messages which this entity attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpOutErrors
OutRedirects -  Redirect messages sent. For a host, this object will always be zero, since hosts do not send redirects
InTimestampReps - Timestamp Reply messages received
InTimestamps - Timestamp (request) messages received
OutTimestampReps - Timestamp Reply messages sent
OutTimestamps - Timestamp (request) messages sent
InEchoReps - Echo Reply messages received
InEchos - Echo (request) messages received
OutEchoReps - Echo Reply messages sent
OutEchos - Echo (request) messages sent
InAddrMaskReps - Address Mask Reply messages received
InAddrMasks - Address Mask Request messages received
OutAddrMaskReps - Address Mask Reply messages sent
OutAddrMasks - Address Mask Request messages sent
{{collector}} - Scrape duration
{{collector}} - Scrape duration count

dashboard.title: Kubernetes Node Exporter Full
